poem:
**Defiance in the House**

A morning unfolds with promises,  
words flutter like wary birds—  
Downing Street bows,  
an orchestration of nods and amendments.  
Meg Hillier stands,  
a rebel turned shepherd  
guiding her flock through the tumult.  
The paper snaps shut—  
outside, the world hangs  
on decisions crafted in corridors  
and columns of print.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
